page.title: 06ECOLOGY
page.content: As you drive north on the A9 past Inverness towards Kessock Bridge you will see on your right 169 acres of land.This has been reclaimed from mudflats along the south shore of the Firth.It is Inverness Town Dump.In another century it could be twice as wide.It is a real asset to the town. The dump is a very busy place.All day lorries come and go.Even on Sundays you can drop off your old T.V.set or your garden rubbish. To reclaim land tyre walls are built to make lagoons.These are filled with hard core.Then rubbish goes in with soil on top.Trees and bushes begin to grow. The methane gas below is being monitored to see if the land will be safe for buildings.The old dump of coal ashes nearer the bridge will be a permanent site for travelling people.
